messages.message: Regulators often require document verification based on the language the KYC team can understand. For example, Thai clients applying to a forex trading platform (the prospect) need to provide documents in both Thai and English

another reason - if you want to provide a set of good prompts and the answers to a client, or save them for future use (i.e. the client and i are working through a demo together and afterwards i ask what fields they might be searching for.... and they respond "oh all the ones we just worked on are great")
Got it. We are actively prioritising the use case you describe @Andrew Sherrill!
